Posts.Content: On 6/30/2007 Lisap wrote: Hi there, I was also just recently diagnosed with mets to the bones and liver.  My CA153 levels were high (135).  That is how they found mine.  There really aren't any symptoms for the liver until quite advanced. Then I also had a biopsy done to confirm that it was breast cancer.  Mine was a pretty large lesion, though.  If your spot is too small to biopsy, they will probably just put you on Xeloda and/or Tykerb and watch you for now, although it would be good for them to know if your spot is ER+/- and Her2neu+/- Lisa   I will immediately research "CA153".....never heard of it even though I know there are several liver tests.   I plan to check PH levels recommended by Steve.  Grateful to you Lisa and Steve
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer to Liver Cancer

Posts.Content: Any women out there with this combo? I cannot find in research any firm symptom list.  A CT scan revealed a small hypodensity on the liver with a mildly elevated AST level of 43.   I am worried that my liver is my most vulnerable site for spread of breast cancer.What else should I look for? More liver tests? I know there are 6 more other than AST.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer to Liver Cancer
